title: Autumn Mixed Bill review, Birmingham Royal Ballet BRB and Ballet Black, Sadler's Wells: a Suit that fits like a dream
text:
Birmingham Royal Ballet’s romantically tinged new triple bill is two-thirds excellent but gets off to a dismal start. The opener – also the evening’s only premiere – is by Australian choreographer Jack Lister, and is called A Brief Nostalgia.

Brief – at 25-odd minutes – but not brief enough. It’s heralded in the programme as being about “the beauty, pain and sheer inevitability of the memories we collect”, but anyone anticipating a poetic, even Proustian musing on the bittersweet ungraspability of the past will be sorely disappointed.

It feels, instead, like vague, still-resonating recollections of one nightmarish, often sexualised scenario after another, with stage, costumes and (you feel by...
description: Birmingham Royal Ballet’s romantically tinged new triple bill is two-thirds excellent but gets off to a dismal start.
